title: BRITAX B-SAFE: Installing without the Base
description: Instructions for installing the BRITAX B-SAFE in your vehicle without the base. For more information about the B-SAFE

asset.author: Britax Child Safety, Inc
asset.hookText: Instructions for installing the BRITAX B-SAFE in your vehicle without the base. For more information about the B-SAFE, visit: http://www.britaxusa.com/car-seats/b-safe.

transcripts: Installing without the base. Check that your vehicle seat belt is compatible with the infant car seat by referring to your vehicle owner's manual and page eight in the product user guide. Check your vehicle owner's manual to determine how to lock your vehicle belt system secure a child in infant seat before installing car seat in vehicle. To find the belt guides release the elastic loops on the stroller adapter and lift the cover to expose the belt guides for installation. When installed the level line on the shell of the infant car seat should be level to the ground. Place the car seat against the towel or pool noodles to level the shell and install. Lap shoulder belt insulation placed the infant car seat rear facing on the vehicle seat pull the vehicle seat belt out and route the lap portion of the vehicle seat belt through the belt guides. Do not route the shoulder portion of the vehicle belts to the belt guide. Verify that the vehicle seat belt is not twisted and then buckle. Lock your vehicle seat belt system as instructed by your vehicle owner's manual. Push the infant car seat firmly into the vehicle seat while removing all slack from the lap portion and then the shoulder portion of the vehicle seat belt. If you cannot lock your vehicle seat belt you must use a locking clip. Locking clips are available from Britax. Verify that all connections are secure. The infant car seat is secure when it moves less than one inch front to back or side to side at the vehicle belt path. Ensure that the carry handle is in one of the three locked positions. The proper recline angle is achieved when the level line on the shell is level to the ground. Lap belt installation. Place the infant car seat rear facing on the vehicle seat. Pull the vehicle seat belt out and route it through the belt guides. Verify the vehicle seat belt is not twisted and then buckle. Push the infant car seat firmly into the vehicle seat while removing all slack from the vehicle seat belt. Verify that all connections are secure. The infant car seat is secured when it moves less than one inch front to back or side to side at the vehicle belt path. Ensure that the carry handle is in one of the three locked positions. The proper recline angle is achieved when the level line on the shell is level to the ground.
